heading: Addition and Subtraction of Like Fractions.

topics.heading: Addition and Subtraction of Like Fractions.

questions.question: Mr. Johnson cut a large piece of paper into 45/47 pieces for the invites. If 36/47 of the paper was used for the first batch of invites, how much paper is remaining?
Lily had 25/60 of her invitations ready. What is the simplest form of this fraction?
Ben used 44/48 of his paper for invitations. Simplify this fraction.
Lily and Ben prepared 19/67 of their invitations by the end of the first day. They managed to send out 8/67 of them. How many invitations do they still need to send?
Lily and Ben each prepared 2/4 of an invitation. How much of an invitation did they prepare together?
Ben discovered he made 30/54 of the invitations incorrectly. What is this fraction in simplest form?
At the art festival, they used 76/50 of a large roll of ribbon. If 41/50 of the ribbon was used for decorations, how much ribbon is left?
Mr. Johnson cut 45/50 of a sheet for the extra invites. Simplify this fraction.
If Mr. Johnson cuts 11/97 of a sheet for Lily, 42/97 for Ben, and another 26/97 for extra invites, how much of the sheet did he cut in total?
Lily realized that 27/48 of her invitation was unnecessary. Simplify the fraction.
Lily has 50/80 of a sheet of decorative paper. She receives another 45/80 sheet from Ben. After using 43/80 of a sheet for her project, how much decorative paper does she have left?
Lily has 23/71 of a sheet of decorative paper left after her project. She uses 16/71 of it to make a card. How much of the sheet does she have left?
Mr. Johnson helped Lily and Ben by cutting 45/31​ of a sheet of paper for Lily and 21/31​ for Ben. How much of the sheet did he cut in total?
Ben has 9/26 of a jar of marbles. He buys another 11/26 of a jar of marbles at the store. After giving away 11/20 of the marbles to his friend, how many marbles does Ben have left?
Mr. Johnson cut 15/25 of a sheet for Lily. What is this fraction in simplest form?
Ben had 35/62 of a large piece of construction paper. He gave 24/62 of it to Lily. How much of the construction paper does Ben have now?
If Lily added the 9/20 paper of the invitation to the 12/20 she already prepared, how much of the invitation does she have now?
Lily realized that 27/63 of the invitations were damaged. Simplify this fraction.
Lily and Ben prepared 36/82 of an invitation. What is the fraction in its simplest form?
